rounds.response:
I’m the Big Blind in the second-to-act seat post-flop with a very weak hand: 2♠ 3♥ unsuited. I’d finish last out of every possible Hold’em starting hand vs. a single opponent. Against a standard raise (here the 20-chip big blind) I should simply fold. Additionally, we are only 15 big blinds deep, so entering a pot out of position with junk is a huge leak.

[Fold]

rounds.response:
I have a pair of sixes on an A-8-6 rainbow flop. My hand strength isn’t great; the ace scares me and my kicker is weak. Opponent checked to me, so I can either:

1. Check to control the pot size in position (BB vs SB) and see a free turn.
2. Make a small value bet to protect against overcards and extract from ace-high / weaker pairs, though the ace is a very scary card for me.

Given a pair of sixes with a king kicker is marginal on an ace-high board and both ranges are capped by the pre-flop sizing, I’ll take a cautious line.

[Check]
